meanings.definition: The value equivalent to that of someone or something
meanings.sent1: The worths of friendship cannot be measured in dollars.
meanings.sent2: She always considers the worths of her possessions before making a decision.
meanings.sent3: The worths of his jokes are priceless, always bringing a smile to everyone's face.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness worths more than all the gold in the world.
meanings.sent5: The worths of honesty and integrity shine brightly in his character.

meanings.definition: The amount of money that something is considered to be worth
meanings.sent1: The worths of the antique vase surprised everyone at the auction.
meanings.sent2: He was willing to pay a high price for the worths of the rare painting.
meanings.sent3: The worths of the old coin collection made him feel like a treasure hunter.
meanings.sent4: The worths of the jewelry collection sparkled like stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: She carefully assessed the worths of each item before setting a price tag.

meanings.definition: To have a particular value in money or other terms
meanings.sent1: She worths her time and skills highly.
meanings.sent2: The vintage car worths more than he originally thought.
meanings.sent3: He worths his collection of stamps as if they were rare gems.
meanings.sent4: The memories from that trip worth more than any material possession.
meanings.sent5: The painting worths a fortune to art collectors around the world.
